description: Resigning from a job is a normal part of career progression. Doing it professionally and gracefully is important to maintain good relationships and protect your reputation.
sentences: Always resign in person or via a video call with your direct manager before sending a formal email.
Write a clear, concise, and professional resignation letter.
Serve your full notice period as per your employment contract.
Ensure a smooth handover of your responsibilities to your replacement or colleagues.
Leave on a positive note, regardless of your reasons for leaving.

dos: Be prepared to state your last working day.
Offer to help with the transition process.
Thank your employer for the opportunity.
donts: Don't resign over email or text without a prior conversation.
Don't speak negatively about the company, your boss, or colleagues.
Don't slack off during your notice period.
Don't brag about your new job to your current colleagues.
